source:
A sample AMP Article

This is a sample article demonstrating how to write a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.

by Sebastian Benz

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, voluptua oporteat cum cu, eu vix interesset scribentur. Et iudico efficiendi duo, vim an odio iusto reformidans. At maluisset scripserit duo, cum in sumo delenit. Quot erant maiestatis usu ut. Ne mea maiorum vivendum argumentum, tale utinam postea mei in, eam in odio dicta patrioque.

Cum ad graeci legimus, ut duo omnesque petentium, mei saepe explicari principes eu. Ex mei ocurreret expetendis, ex errem blandit has. Phaedrum mediocrem appellantur his ut. Erat viris mediocrem id ius, ad dicta appareat assentior sit. Nec et nullam singulis moderatius, est reque vidisse copiosae eu.

Mutat dolores ea duo. Usu cu dico everti tincidunt, pri vero nullam vidisse no. Eam novum aeque populo cu. Verear contentiones ne quo, no sed consulatu definitionem.

Related Articles

These articles might be interesting for you as well:

This page might use cookies if your analytics vendor requires them.

sections.doc_: ## Introduction
sections.cachedMarkedDoc: Introduction
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Introduction

sections.doc_: This is a sample template for a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc: This is a sample template for a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.
sections.normalizedDoc_: This is a sample template for a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.

sections.doc_: ## Setup
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Setup

sections.doc_: All additionally used AMP components must be imported in the header. Import `amp-social-share` for adding share buttons
sections.normalizedDoc_: All additionally used AMP components must be imported in the header. Import `amp-social-share` for adding share buttons

sections.doc_: Import `amp-iframe` to embed an interactive chart
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-iframe` to embed an interactive chart

sections.doc_: Import `amp-carousel` to implement an image gallery
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-carousel` to implement an image gallery

sections.doc_: Import `amp-user-notification` to display a cookie notification
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-user-notification` to display a cookie notification

sections.doc_: Import `amp-list` to get a fresh a list of related articles
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-list` to get a fresh a list of related articles

sections.doc_: Import `amp-mustache` as a format template for `amp-list`
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-mustache` as a format template for `amp-list`

sections.doc_: Import `amp-analytics` for tracking usage
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-analytics` for tracking usage

sections.doc_: Import `amp-ad` to display ads
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import `amp-ad` to display ads

sections.doc_: ## Metadata
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Metadata

sections.doc_: The Top Stories carousel requires schema.org markup for one of the following types: Article, NewsArticle, BlogPosting, or VideoObject. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/structured-data/carousels/top-stories#markup_specification).
sections.code:
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
"@context": "http://schema.org",
"@type": "NewsArticle",
"mainEntityOfPage": "http://localhost:8080/samples_templates/news_article/",
"headline": "Lorem Ipsum",
"datePublished": "2016-04-21T11:55:02Z",
"dateModified": "2016-04-21T11:55:02Z",
"description": "A sample news article build with AMP.",
"author": {
  "@type": "Person",
  "name": "Sebastian Benz"
},
"publisher": {
  "@type": "Organization",
  "name": "Google",
  "logo": {
    "@type": "ImageObject",
    "url": "http://cdn.ampproject.org/logo.jpg",
    "width": 600,
    "height": 60
  }
},
"image": {
  "@type": "ImageObject",
  "url": "/static/samples/img/landscape_lake_1280x857.jpg",
  "height": 1280,
  "width": 857
}
}
</script>
sections.normalizedDoc_: The Top Stories carousel requires schema.org markup for one of the following types: Article, NewsArticle, BlogPosting, or VideoObject. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/structured-data/carousels/top-stories#markup_specification).

sections.code:
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
<style amp-custom>
  :root {
    --color-primary: #005AF0;
    --color-text-light: #fff;
    --color-text-dark: #000;
    --color-bg-light: #FAFAFC;

    --space-1: .5rem;  /* 8px */
    --space-2: 1rem;   /* 16px */

    --box-shadow-1: 0 1px 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.14), 0 1px 1px -1px rgba(0,0,0,.14), 0 1px 5px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.12);
    }
    .figure {
      margin: var(--space-2) 0;
      padding: 0;
    }
    .figure>figcaption{
      padding: var(--space-1) var(--space-2);
    }
    .amp-ad-container {
      display: flex;
      margin: 0 auto;
    }
    .carousel .slide > amp-img > img {
      object-fit: contain;
    }
    .heading {
      padding-bottom: var(--space-1);
    }
    .heading h1 {
      font-size: 3rem;
      line-height: 3.5rem;
      margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
    }
    .heading > #summary {
      font-weight: 500;
    }
    .heading > small {
      color: var(--color-primary);
    }
    .related {
      background-color: var(--color-bg-light);
      margin: var(--space-2);
      display: flex;
      color: var(--color-text-dark);
      padding: 0;
      box-shadow: var(--box-shadow-1);
      text-decoration: none;
    }
    .related > span {
      font-weight: 400;
      margin: var(--space-1);
    }
    .related:hover {
      background-color: var(--color-bg-light);
    }
    .cookie-disclaimer {
      padding: var(--space-1);
      background: var(--color-bg-light);
      text-align: center;
      color: var(--color-text-dark);
      border-top: 1px solid var(--color-text-dark);
    }
  </style>

</head>
<body>

A sample AMP Article

This is a sample article demonstrating how to write a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.

by Sebastian Benz
sections.preview:
A sample AMP Article

This is a sample article demonstrating how to write a news article in AMP. It demonstrates the usage of AMP components which works well in news articles. Examples include social sharing, image galleries, personalized content, ads, and more.

by Sebastian Benz

sections.doc_: ## Social sharing
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Social sharing

sections.doc_: The Social Share extension provides a common interface for share buttons.  Learn more about `amp-social-share` [here](/documentation/components/amp-social-share).
sections.normalizedDoc_: The Social Share extension provides a common interface for share buttons.  Learn more about `amp-social-share` [here](/documentation/components/amp-social-share).

sections.doc_: ## Ad support
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Ad support

sections.doc_: There are no limitations regarding the number or placement of ads in an AMP. Learn more about `amp-ad` [here](/documentation/components/amp-ad).
sections.normalizedDoc_: There are no limitations regarding the number or placement of ads in an AMP. Learn more about `amp-ad` [here](/documentation/components/amp-ad).

sections.doc_: ## Image galleries
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Image galleries

sections.doc_: Use `amp-carousel` for image galleries. Learn more about creating image galleries in AMP [here](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/image_galleries_with_amp-carousel/).
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use `amp-carousel` for image galleries. Learn more about creating image galleries in AMP [here](/documentation/examples/multimedia-animations/image_galleries_with_amp-carousel/).

sections.doc_: ## Interactive content
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Interactive content

sections.doc_: To achieve its performance, AMP HTML doesn't allow custom Javascript. This doesn't mean that you can't created visually rich and interactive websites with AMP. Embed interactive content via `amp-iframe`. Learn more about `amp-iframe` [here](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-iframe-v0.1.md).
sections.normalizedDoc_: To achieve its performance, AMP HTML doesn't allow custom Javascript. This doesn't mean that you can't created visually rich and interactive websites with AMP. Embed interactive content via `amp-iframe`. Learn more about `amp-iframe` [here](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-iframe-v0.1.md).

sections.doc_: ## Embedding related content
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Embedding related content

sections.code: These articles might be interesting for you as well:
sections.preview: These articles might be interesting for you as well:

sections.doc_: It's a good idea to recommend related content to your readers. With `amp-list` it is possible to dynamically include personalized content into your AMPs. It's a good idea to link to the AMP version of related content in order to keep the user in the fast AMP world. Learn more about `amp-list` [here](/documentation/components/amp-list)
sections.normalizedDoc_: It's a good idea to recommend related content to your readers. With `amp-list` it is possible to dynamically include personalized content into your AMPs. It's a good idea to link to the AMP version of related content in order to keep the user in the fast AMP world. Learn more about `amp-list` [here](/documentation/components/amp-list)

sections.doc_: ## Cookie consent
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Cookie consent

sections.doc_: Use `amp-user-notification` to implement a cookie consent form (if needed). By default, the AMP runtime doesn't use cookies. Some analytics vendors might use require cookies though. Learn more about `amp-user-notification` [here](/documentation/components/reference/amp-user-notification.html)
sections.code:
<amp-user-notification class="cookie-disclaimer"
  layout="nodisplay"
  id="amp-user-notification1">
  This page might use cookies if your analytics vendor requires them.
  <button on="tap:amp-user-notification1.dismiss">Accept</button>
</amp-user-notification>
sections.preview:
<amp-user-notification class="cookie-disclaimer"
    layout="nodisplay"
    id="amp-user-notification1">
    This page might use cookies if your analytics vendor requires them.
    <button on="tap:amp-user-notification1.dismiss">Accept</button>
  </amp-user-notification>
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use `amp-user-notification` to implement a cookie consent form (if needed). By default, the AMP runtime doesn't use cookies. Some analytics vendors might use require cookies though. Learn more about `amp-user-notification` [here](/documentation/components/reference/amp-user-notification.html)

sections.doc_: ## User analytics
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## User analytics

sections.doc_: Analytics must be configured in the body. Here we use Google Analytics to track pageviews.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Analytics must be configured in the body. Here we use Google Analytics to track pageviews.

document.head:
<meta charset="utf-8">
      <title>News Article</title>
      <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-social-share" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-social-share-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-iframe" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-iframe-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-carousel" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-carousel-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-user-notification" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-user-notification-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-list" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-list-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-template="amp-mustache" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-mustache-0.2.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-analytics" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-analytics-0.1.js"></script>
      <script async custom-element="amp-ad" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-ad-0.1.js"></script>

      <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/news-publishing/news_article/index.html">

      <script type="application/ld+json">
{
      "@context": "http://schema.org",
      "@type": "NewsArticle",
      "mainEntityOfPage": "http://localhost:8080/samples_templates/news_article/",
      "headline": "Lorem Ipsum",
      "datePublished": "2016-04-21T11:55:02Z",
      "dateModified": "2016-04-21T11:55:02Z",
      "description": "A sample news article build with AMP.",
      "author": {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "Sebastian Benz"
      },
      "publisher": {
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "Google",
        "logo": {
          "@type": "ImageObject",
          "url": "http://cdn.ampproject.org/logo.jpg",
          "width": 600,
          "height": 60
        }
      },
      "image": {
        "@type": "ImageObject",
        "url": "/static/samples/img/landscape_lake_1280x857.jpg",
        "height": 1280,
        "width": 857
      }
    }
      </script>
      <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
      <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
document.title: News Article
document._description: This is a sample template for a news article in AMP.
